newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Briton gets six years on Russian drug charge.
newsitem.headline: Briton gets six years on Russian drug charge.

text.p: A British teenager was sentenced to six years in a Russian labour camp on Thursday for smuggling 4.6 kg (10 lb) of cocaine into Russia.
Karen Henderson, 18, listened impassively as Judge Sergei Lebedev dismissed her claim that she had bought her suitcase at Havana airport without knowing that it contained drugs.
Her family were visibly upset and her sister Dawn burst into tears as Henderson was led away by guards.

"I believe in justice. I really hope that your honour has taken all the facts into account. I told you the truth. I hope you also believe in justice," Henderson said in a brief statement before her sentence was delivered.
British embassy officials said Henderson was likely to appeal against the sentence within a week. She may also seek a pardon from President Boris Yeltsin.
Russian officials discovered the cocaine when they stopped Henderson at Moscow's Sheremetyevo airport last February.
She said she had noticed her suitcase was damaged as she prepared to catch a flight from Havana to Warsaw via Moscow and bought a replacement case from a man she met at the airport.

Henderson is being held in Moscow's overcrowded Butyrskaya prison, which is also home to Dutch woman Suzanne Vorstenbosch, serving a six-year sentence after pleading guilty to smuggling cocaine into Russia.
